headline: Cash Money 4.0: Pirates, Pacts, and Possibility
description: A shift from Imskir back to blue-black-green brilliance. Thrasios meets Francisco in this new brew—a tempo-heavy, draw-smart, spell-slinging pirate deck built around Gaea's Cradle value and OTTERBALL trickery. Version 4.0 explores style, story, and shifting identities through gameplay.
timeFelt: June dusk, head buzzing with deck tension
resonantThread: Changing identities through commander selection and playstyle
whyItMatters: Each deck choice becomes a self-portrait. Returning to familiar commanders reaffirms values, while building anew reflects inner evolution.
articleExcerpt: Played Imskir, felt frustrated and obsessively built Thrasisco (Thrasios/Francisco). It seems cool.
sourceFragments: Borne Upon a Wind, Carpet of Flowers, Valley Floodcaller... a swirl of tempo and answers.
I now the deck I a best with is Malcolm Tymna but that is pretty boring honestly.
Magic decks feel like masks—some fit, some transform you. This one? A mirror.

associatedMedia.description: Decklist screenshot of 'Cash Money 4.0'—Francisco & Thrasios Pirate cEDH
